00026 KSystemRecord::KSystemRecord(const KSystemRecord &aRec)

00031 KSystemRecord& KSystemRecord::operator=(const KSystemRecord &aRec)
00032 {
00033         if(&aRec == this) return *this;
00034         
00035         CopyLocalMembers(aRec);
00036         return *this;
00037 }
00038 
00039 void KSystemRecord::CopyLocalMembers(const KSystemRecord &aRec)
00040 {
00041         fRunStartTime = aRec.fRunStartTime;
00042         fRunEndTime = aRec.fRunEndTime;
00043         fIsSystemOn = aRec.fIsSystemOn;
00044 }
00045 KSystemRecord::~KSystemRecord(void)
00046 {
00047         //
00048         
00049   //Does calling clear at destruction take too much computing time?
00050   Clear("C");
00051 
00052 }

00054 void KSystemRecord::Clear(Option_t* /* opt */)
00055 {
00056   //Clear the base classes and then clear/delete any local
00057   //members. Its necessary for this Clear method to exist
00058   //in the case that instances of this object are stored
00059   //inside of a TClonesArray
00060   //Also, if this class holds any TClonesArrays, it must call
00061   //TClonesArray::Clear("C")
00062 
00063   //Clear and delete local objects here. 
00064 
00065   //Re initialize local members here and prepare for the next use of this class.
00066   InitializeMembers();
00067 
00068 }
00069 
00070 void KSystemRecord::InitializeMembers(void)
00071 {
00072         // Initialize local members
00073         
00074   //WARNING - THIS METHOD SHOULD NEVER ALLOCATE SPACE FOR POINTERS
00075   //ONLY SET MEMBERS ON THE STACK TO THEIR INITIAL VALUES
00076         
00077         //fRunNumber=0;
00078         fRunStartTime = -99.;
00079         fRunEndTime = -99.;
00080         fIsSystemOn = 0;
00081 }
00082 
00083 Bool_t KSystemRecord::IsSame(const KSystemRecord &aRec, Bool_t bPrint) const
00084 {
00085         //Compares two objects and their member variables to test for equality.
00086         //If bPrint is set to true, then a message for each member variable that is different
00087         //will print to standard out. Otherwise, this method will return false and quit
00088         //checking member variables as soon as it finds a unequal data member.
00089         
00090         Bool_t bIsEqual = true; //assume its true, then test for differences
00091         
00092         if(fRunStartTime != aRec.fRunStartTime){
00093                 bIsEqual = false;
00094                 if (bPrint) 
00095                         cout << "KSystemRecord fRunStartTime Not Equal. lhs: " 
00096                         << fRunStartTime << " != rhs " << aRec.fRunStartTime << endl;           
00097                 else
00098                         return false;  
00099         }
00100         
00101         if(fRunEndTime != aRec.fRunEndTime){
00102                 bIsEqual = false;
00103                 if (bPrint) 
00104                         cout << "KSystemRecord fRunEndTime Not Equal. lhs: " 
00105                         << fRunEndTime << " != rhs " << aRec.fRunEndTime << endl;       
00106                 else
00107                         return false;  
00108         }
00109         
00110         if(fIsSystemOn != aRec.fIsSystemOn){
00111                 bIsEqual = false;
00112                 if (bPrint) 
00113                         cout << "KSystemRecord fIsSystemOn Not Equal. lhs: " 
00114                         << fIsSystemOn << " != rhs " << aRec.fIsSystemOn << endl;               
00115                 else
00116                         return false;  
00117         }
00118         
00119         return bIsEqual;
00120 }
